citation.article-title: Ramlibacter tataouinensis gen. nov., sp. nov., and Ramlibacter henchirensis sp. nov., cyst-producing bacteria isolated from subdesert soil in Tunisia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Ramlibacter henchirensis sp. nov.
Ramlibacter henchirensis (hen.chi.ren′sis. N.L. adj. masc. henchirensis from Arabic henchir boundary stones).
Ramlibacter henchirensis has all the characteristics of the genus Ramlibacter.
Aerobic chemo-organotrophic growth by oxidizing acetate, pyruvate, β-hydroxybutyrate, γ-hydroxybutyrate, dl-lactate, propionate, Tween 40, Tween 80, α-ketovalerate and α-ketobutyrate.
None of the other substrates of Biolog GN or GP microplates are oxidized.
Positive for gelatin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase activity.
Optimal pH and temperature for growth: 7·5 and 30 °C.
The DNA G+C content is 66·6 mol%.
The type strain is TMB834T (=DSM 14656T =ATCC BAA-408T =LMG 21542T).
